sets_the_width_of_object_pixel_percentag: Sets the width of object. Pixel, percentage and LV_SIZE_CONTENT values can be used. Percentage values are relative to the width of the parent's content area.
sets_the_height_of_object_pixel_percenta: Sets the height of object. Pixel, percentage and LV_SIZE_CONTENT can be used. Percentage values are relative to the height of the parent's content area.
sets_a_minimal_width_pixel_and_percentag: Sets a minimal width. Pixel and percentage values can be used. Percentage values are relative to the width of the parent's content area.
sets_a_maximal_width_pixel_and_percentag: Sets a maximal width. Pixel and percentage values can be used. Percentage values are relative to the width of the parent's content area.
sets_a_minimal_height_pixel_and_percenta: Sets a minimal height. Pixel and percentage values can be used. Percentage values are relative to the width of the parent's content area.
sets_a_maximal_height_pixel_and_percenta: Sets a maximal height. Pixel and percentage values can be used. Percentage values are relative to the height of the parent's content area.
set_the_x_coordinate_of_the_object_consi: Set the X coordinate of the object considering the set align. Pixel and percentage values can be used. Percentage values are relative to the width of the parent's content area.
set_the_y_coordinate_of_the_object_consi: Set the Y coordinate of the object considering the set align. Pixel and percentage values can be used. Percentage values are relative to the height of the parent's content area.
set_the_alignment_which_tells_from_which: Set the alignment which tells from which point of the parent the X and Y coordinates should be interpreted. The possible values are: LV_ALIGN_DEFAULT, LV_ALIGN_TOP_LEFT/MID/RIGHT, LV_ALIGN_BOTTOM_LEFT/MID/RIGHT, LV_ALIGN_LEFT/RIGHT_MID, LV_ALIGN_CENTER. LV_ALIGN_DEFAULT means LV_ALIGN_TOP_LEFT with LTR base direction and LV_ALIGN_TOP_RIGHT with RTL base direction.
make_the_object_wider_on_both_sides_with: Make the object wider on both sides with this value. Pixel and percentage (with lv_pct(x)) values can be used. Percentage values are relative to the object's width.
make_the_object_higher_on_both_sides_wit: Make the object higher on both sides with this value. Pixel and percentage (with lv_pct(x)) values can be used. Percentage values are relative to the object's height.
move_the_object_with_this_value_in_x_dir: Move the object with this value in X direction. Applied after layouts, aligns and other positioning. Pixel and percentage (with lv_pct(x)) values can be used. Percentage values are relative to the object's width.
move_the_object_with_this_value_in_y_dir: Move the object with this value in Y direction. Applied after layouts, aligns and other positioning. Pixel and percentage (with lv_pct(x)) values can be used. Percentage values are relative to the object's height.
zoom_an_objects_the_value_256_or_lv_img_: Zoom an objects. The value 256 (or LV_IMG_ZOOM_NONE) means normal size, 128 half size, 512 double size, and so on
zoom_an_object_horizontally_the_value_25: Zoom an object horizontally. The value 256 (or LV_IMG_ZOOM_NONE) means normal size, 128 half size, 512 double size, and so on
zoom_an_object_vertically_the_value_256_: Zoom an object vertically. The value 256 (or LV_IMG_ZOOM_NONE) means normal size, 128 half size, 512 double size, and so on
rotate_an_objects_the_value_is_interpret: Rotate an objects. The value is interpreted in 0.1 degree units. E.g. 450 means 45 deg.
set_the_pivot_point_s_x_coordinate_for_t: Set the pivot point's X coordinate for transformations. Relative to the object's top left corner'
set_the_pivot_point_s_y_coordinate_for_t: Set the pivot point's Y coordinate for transformations. Relative to the object's top left corner'
set_the_layout_if_the_object_the_childre: Set the layout if the object. The children will be repositioned and resized according to the policies set for the layout. For the possible values see the documentation of the layouts.
determines_a_type_of_flex_layout_used: Determines a type of Flex layout used
determines_how_to_distribute_the_items_i: Determines how to distribute the items in their track on the cross axis.
determines_how_to_distribute_the_tracks: Determines how to distribute the tracks
flex_grow_can_be_used_to_make_one_or_mor: Flex grow can be used to make one or more children fill the available space on the track. When more children have grow parameters, the available space will be distributed proportionally to the grow values.
defines_how_to_distribute_the_columns: Defines how to distribute the columns.
an_array_to_describe_the_rows_of_the_gri: An array to describe the rows of the grid. Should be LV_GRID_TEMPLATE_LAST terminated.
an_array_to_describe_the_columns_of_the_: An array to describe the columns of the grid. Should be LV_GRID_TEMPLATE_LAST terminated.
set_the_column_in_which_the_object_shoul: Set the column in which the object should be placed.
set_how_to_align_the_object_horizontally: Set how to align the object horizontally.
set_the_row_in_which_the_object_should_b: Set the row in which the object should be placed.
set_how_to_align_the_object_vertically: Set how to align the object vertically.
sets_the_padding_on_the_top_it_makes_the: Sets the padding on the top. It makes the content area smaller in this direction.
sets_the_padding_on_the_bottom_it_makes_: Sets the padding on the bottom. It makes the content area smaller in this direction.
sets_the_padding_on_the_left_it_makes_th: Sets the padding on the left. It makes the content area smaller in this direction.
sets_the_padding_on_the_right_it_makes_t: Sets the padding on the right. It makes the content area smaller in this direction.
sets_the_padding_between_the_rows_used_b: Sets the padding between the rows. Used by the layouts.
sets_the_padding_between_the_columns_use: Sets the padding between the columns. Used by the layouts.
sets_the_margin_on_the_top_the_object_wi: Sets the margin on the top. The object will keep this space from its siblings in layouts.
sets_the_margin_on_the_bottom_the_object: Sets the margin on the bottom. The object will keep this space from its siblings in layouts.
sets_the_margin_on_the_left_the_object_w: Sets the margin on the left. The object will keep this space from its siblings in layouts.
sets_the_margin_on_the_right_the_object_: Sets the margin on the right. The object will keep this space from its siblings in layouts.
set_the_background_color_of_the_object: Set the background color of the object.
set_the_opacity_of_the_background_value_: Set the opacity of the background. Value 0, LV_OPA_0 or LV_OPA_TRANSP means fully transparent, 255, LV_OPA_100 or LV_OPA_COVER means fully covering, other values or LV_OPA_10, LV_OPA_20, etc means semi transparency.
set_the_gradient_color_of_the_background: Set the gradient color of the background. Used only if grad_dir is not LV_GRAD_DIR_NONE
set_the_direction_of_the_gradient_of_the: Set the direction of the gradient of the background. The possible values are LV_GRAD_DIR_NONE/HOR/VER.
set_the_point_from_which_the_background_: Set the point from which the background color should start for gradients. 0 means to top/left side, 255 the bottom/right side, 128 the center, and so on
Set the point from which the background's gradient color should start. 0 means to top/left side, 255 the bottom/right side, 128 the center, and so on
set_the_gradient_definition_the_pointed_: Set the gradient definition. The pointed instance must exist while the object is alive. NULL to disable. It wraps BG_GRAD_COLOR, BG_GRAD_DIR, BG_MAIN_STOP and BG_GRAD_STOP into one descriptor and allows creating gradients with more colors too.
set_the_dithering_mode_of_the_gradient_o: Set the dithering mode of the gradient of the background. The possible values are LV_DITHER_NONE/ORDERED/ERR_DIFF.
set_a_background_image_can_be_a_pointer_: Set a background image. Can be a pointer to lv_img_dsc_t, a path to a file or an LV_SYMBOL_...
set_the_opacity_of_the_background_image_: Set the opacity of the background image. Value 0, LV_OPA_0 or LV_OPA_TRANSP means fully transparent, 255, LV_OPA_100 or LV_OPA_COVER means fully covering, other values or LV_OPA_10, LV_OPA_20, etc means semi transparency.
set_a_color_to_mix_to_the_background_ima: Set a color to mix to the background image.
set_the_intensity_of_background_image_re: Set the intensity of background image recoloring. Value 0, LV_OPA_0 or LV_OPA_TRANSP means no mixing, 255, LV_OPA_100 or LV_OPA_COVER means full recoloring, other values or LV_OPA_10, LV_OPA_20, etc are interpreted proportionally.
if_enabled_the_background_image_will_be_: If enabled the background image will be tiled. The possible values are true or false.
set_the_color_of_the_border: Set the color of the border
set_the_opacity_of_the_border_value_0_lv: Set the opacity of the border. Value 0, LV_OPA_0 or LV_OPA_TRANSP means fully transparent, 255, LV_OPA_100 or LV_OPA_COVER means fully covering, other values or LV_OPA_10, LV_OPA_20, etc means semi transparency.
set_hte_width_of_the_border_only_pixel_v: Set hte width of the border. Only pixel values can be used.
set_only_which_side_s_the_border_should_: Set only which side(s) the border should be drawn. The possible values are LV_BORDER_SIDE_NONE/TOP/BOTTOM/LEFT/RIGHT/INTERNAL. OR-ed values can be used as well, e.g. LV_BORDER_SIDE_TOP | LV_BORDER_SIDE_LEFT.
sets_whether_the_border_should_be_drawn_: Sets whether the border should be drawn before or after the children are drawn. true: after children, false: before children
set_the_width_of_the_outline_in_pixels: Set the width of the outline in pixels.
set_the_color_of_the_outline: Set the color of the outline.
set_the_opacity_of_the_outline_value_0_l: Set the opacity of the outline. Value 0, LV_OPA_0 or LV_OPA_TRANSP means fully transparent, 255, LV_OPA_100 or LV_OPA_COVER means fully covering, other values or LV_OPA_10, LV_OPA_20, etc means semi transparency.
set_the_padding_of_the_outline_i_e_the_g: Set the padding of the outline, i.e. the gap between object and the outline.
set_an_offset_on_the_shadow_in_pixels_in: Set an offset on the shadow in pixels in X direction.
Set an offset on the shadow in pixels in Y direction.
make_the_shadow_calculation_to_use_a_lar: Make the shadow calculation to use a larger or smaller rectangle as base. The value can be in pixel to make the area larger/smaller
set_the_color_of_the_shadow: Set the color of the shadow
set_the_opacity_of_the_shadow_value_0_lv: Set the opacity of the shadow. Value 0, LV_OPA_0 or LV_OPA_TRANSP means fully transparent, 255, LV_OPA_100 or LV_OPA_COVER means fully covering, other values or LV_OPA_10, LV_OPA_20, etc means semi transparency.
set_the_opacity_of_an_image_value_0_lv_o: Set the opacity of an image. Value 0, LV_OPA_0 or LV_OPA_TRANSP means fully transparent, 255, LV_OPA_100 or LV_OPA_COVER means fully covering, other values or LV_OPA_10, LV_OPA_20, etc means semi transparency.
set_color_to_mix_to_the_image: Set color to mix to the image.
set_the_intensity_of_the_color_mixing_va: Set the intensity of the color mixing. Value 0, LV_OPA_0 or LV_OPA_TRANSP means fully transparent, 255, LV_OPA_100 or LV_OPA_COVER means fully covering, other values or LV_OPA_10, LV_OPA_20, etc means semi transparency.
set_the_width_of_the_lines_in_pixel: Set the width of the lines in pixel.
set_the_width_of_dashes_in_pixel_note_th: Set the width of dashes in pixel. Note that dash works only on horizontal and vertical lines
set_the_gap_between_dashes_in_pixel_note: Set the gap between dashes in pixel. Note that dash works only on horizontal and vertical lines
make_the_end_points_of_the_lines_rounded: Make the end points of the lines rounded. true: rounded, false: perpendicular line ending
set_the_color_fo_the_lines: Set the color fo the lines.
set_the_opacity_of_the_lines: Set the opacity of the lines.
set_the_width_thickness_of_the_arcs_in_p: Set the width (thickness) of the arcs in pixel.
make_the_end_points_of_the_arcs_rounded_: Make the end points of the arcs rounded. true: rounded, false: perpendicular line ending
set_the_color_of_the_arc: Set the color of the arc.
set_the_opacity_of_the_arcs: Set the opacity of the arcs.
set_an_image_from_which_the_arc_will_be_: Set an image from which the arc will be masked out. It's useful to display complex effects on the arcs. Can be a pointer to lv_img_dsc_t or a path to a file
sets_the_color_of_the_text: Sets the color of the text.
set_the_opacity_of_the_text_value_0_lv_o: Set the opacity of the text. Value 0, LV_OPA_0 or LV_OPA_TRANSP means fully transparent, 255, LV_OPA_100 or LV_OPA_COVER means fully covering, other values or LV_OPA_10, LV_OPA_20, etc means semi transparency.
set_the_font_of_the_text_a_pointer_lv_fo: Set the font of the text (a pointer lv_font_t *).
set_the_letter_space_in_pixels: Set the letter space in pixels
set_the_line_space_in_pixels: Set the line space in pixels.
set_decoration_for_the_text_the_possible: Set decoration for the text. The possible values are LV_TEXT_DECOR_NONE/UNDERLINE/STRIKETHROUGH. OR-ed values can be used as well.
set_how_to_align_the_lines_of_the_text_n: Set how to align the lines of the text. Note that it doesn't align the object itself, only the lines inside the object. The possible values are LV_TEXT_ALIGN_LEFT/CENTER/RIGHT/AUTO. LV_TEXT_ALIGN_AUTO detect the text base direction and uses left or right alignment accordingly
enable_to_clip_the_overflowed_content_on: Enable to clip the overflowed content on the rounded corner. Can be true or false.
scale_down_all_opacity_values_of_the_obj: Scale down all opacity values of the object by this factor. Value 0, LV_OPA_0 or LV_OPA_TRANSP means fully transparent, 255, LV_OPA_100 or LV_OPA_COVER means fully covering, other values or LV_OPA_10, LV_OPA_20, etc means semi transparency.
mix_a_color_to_all_colors_of_the_object: Mix a color to all colors of the object.
the_intensity_of_mixing_of_color_filter: The intensity of mixing of color filter.
the_animation_template_for_the_object_s_: The animation template for the object's animation. Should be a pointer to lv_anim_t. The animation parameters are widget specific, e.g. animation time could be the E.g. blink time of the cursor on the text area or scroll time of a roller. See the widgets' documentation to learn more.
the_animation_time_in_milliseconds_its_m: The animation time in milliseconds. Its meaning is widget specific. E.g. blink time of the cursor on the text area or scroll time of a roller. See the widgets' documentation to learn more.
the_animation_speed_in_pixel_sec_its_mea: The animation speed in pixel/sec. Its meaning is widget specific. E.g. scroll speed of label. See the widgets' documentation to learn more.
an_initialized_lv_style_transition_dsc_t: An initialized lv_style_transition_dsc_t to describe a transition.
describes_how_to_blend_the_colors_to_the: Describes how to blend the colors to the background. The possible values are LV_BLEND_MODE_NORMAL/ADDITIVE/SUBTRACTIVE/MULTIPLY
set_the_base_direction_of_the_object_the: Set the base direction of the object. The possible values are LV_BIDI_DIR_LTR/RTL/AUTO.
properties_related_to_size_position_alig: Properties related to size, position, alignment and layout of the objects.
properties_to_describe_spacing_between_t: Properties to describe spacing between the parent's sides and the children and among the children. Very similar to the padding properties in HTML.
properties_to_describe_spacing_around_an: Properties to describe spacing around an object. Very similar to the margin properties in HTML.
properties_to_describe_the_background_co: Properties to describe the background color and image of the objects.
properties_to_describe_the_outline_it_s_: Properties to describe the outline. It's like a border but drawn outside of the rectangles.
properties_to_describe_the_shadow_drawn_: Properties to describe the shadow drawn under the rectangles.
properties_to_describe_the_properties_of: Properties to describe the properties of text. All these properties are inherited.
you_should_initialize_your_input_device: // you should initialize your input device
set_group_for_your_input_device: // set group for your input device
use_this_for_encoder_in_simulator: Use this for Encoder in simulator
use_this_for_keyboard_in_simulator: Use this for Keyboard in simulator
an_error_occured_while_building_images_f: An error occured while building images for the LVGL 9.x!
multiple_widgets_with_the_same_name: Multiple widgets with the same name
list_of_actions_to_be_executed_the_follo: List of actions to be executed. The following actions are available:\n\n
selection_of_animation_when_moving_from_: Selection of animation when moving from the previous page to a new page
delay_in_milliseconds_before_the_animati: Delay in milliseconds before the animation starts
put_active_screen_on_the_stack: Put active screen on the stack.
change_the_screen_to_the_specified_scree: Change the screen to the specified screen
action_is_not_available_if_screens_lifet: action is not available if 'Screens lifetime support' is not enabled in Settings - Build
create_the_screen_screens_lifetime_suppo: Create the screen ("Screens lifetime support" should be enabled in Settings - Build)"
delete_the_screen_screens_lifetime_suppo: Delete the screen ("Screens lifetime support" should be enabled in Settings - Build)"
the_boolean_variable_where_to_store_the_: The boolean variable where to store the screen status
check_if_screen_is_created_screens_lifet: Check if screen is created ("Screens lifetime support" should be enabled in Settings - Build)"
the_object_to_set_the_x_coordinate: The object to set the x coordinate
set_the_x_coordinate_of_the_object: Set the x coordinate of the object
the_object_to_get_the_x_coordinate: The object to get the x coordinate
the_variable_to_store_the_x_coordinate: The variable to store the x coordinate
get_the_x_coordinate_of_the_object: Get the x coordinate of the object
the_object_to_set_the_y_coordinate: The object to set the y coordinate
set_the_y_coordinate_of_the_object: Set the y coordinate of the object
the_object_to_get_the_y_coordinate: The object to get the y coordinate
the_variable_to_store_the_y_coordinate: The variable to store the y coordinate
get_the_y_coordinate_of_the_object: Get the y coordinate of the object
the_object_to_set_the_width: The object to set the width
set_the_width_of_the_object: Set the width of the object
the_object_to_get_the_width: The object to get the width
the_variable_to_store_the_width: The variable to store the width
get_the_width_of_the_object: Get the width of the object
the_object_to_set_the_height: The object to set the height
set_the_height_of_the_object: Set the height of the object
the_object_to_get_the_height: The object to get the height
the_variable_to_store_the_height: The variable to store the height
get_the_height_of_the_object: Get the height of the object
the_object_to_set_the_opacity: The object to set the opacity
set_the_opacity_of_the_object: Set the opacity of the object
the_object_to_get_the_opacity: The object to get the opacity
the_variable_to_store_the_opacity: The variable to store the opacity
get_the_opacity_of_the_object: Get the opacity of the object
the_object_to_add_the_style: The object to add the style
add_a_style_to_the_object: Add a style to the object
the_object_to_remove_the_style: The object to remove the style
remove_a_style_from_the_object: Remove a style from the object
the_object_to_set_the_hidden_flag: The object to set the hidden flag
set_the_hidden_flag_of_the_object: Set the hidden flag of the object
the_object_to_add_the_flag: The object to add the flag
add_a_flag_to_the_object: Add a flag to the object
the_object_to_clear_the_flag: The object to clear the flag
clear_a_flag_from_the_object: Clear a flag from the object
the_object_to_check_the_flag: The object to check the flag
the_variable_to_store_the_result: The variable to store the result
check_if_the_object_has_the_specified_fl: Check if the object has the specified flag
the_object_to_set_the_checked_state: The object to set the checked state
set_the_checked_state_of_the_object: Set the checked state of the object
the_object_to_set_the_disabled_state: The object to set the disabled state
set_the_disabled_state_of_the_object: Set the disabled state of the object
the_object_to_add_the_state: The object to add the state
add_a_state_to_the_object: Add a state to the object
the_object_to_clear_the_state: The object to clear the state
clear_a_state_from_the_object: Clear a state from the object
the_object_to_check_the_state: The object to check the state
check_if_the_object_has_the_specified_st: Check if the object has the specified state
the_arc_to_set_the_value: The arc to set the value
set_the_value_of_the_arc: Set the value of the arc
the_bar_to_set_the_value: The bar to set the value
use_animation_when_setting_the_value: Use animation when setting the value
set_the_value_of_the_bar: Set the value of the bar
0_based_index_of_the_button_to_modify_no: 0 based index of the button to modify. (Not counting new lines)
clear_the_attributes_of_a_button_of_the_: Clear the attributes of a button of the button matrix
the_integer_variable_where_to_store_the_: The integer variable where to store the year
The integer variable where to store the month (1..12)
The integer variable where to store the day (1..31)
the_dropdown_to_set_the_selected_item: The dropdown to set the selected item
the_index_of_the_selected_item: The index of the selected item
set_the_selected_item_of_the_dropdown: Set the selected item of the dropdown
the_image_to_set_the_source: The image to set the source
the_source_image_to_set_given_as_a_strin: The source image to set given as a string
set_the_source_image_of_the_image: Set the source image of the image
the_image_to_set_the_angle: The image to set the angle
the_angle_to_set_angle_has_0_1_degree_pr: The angle to set. Angle has 0.1 degree precision, so for 45.8° set 458.
set_the_angle_of_the_image: Set the angle of the image
the_image_to_set_the_zoom: The image to set the zoom
the_zoom_to_set_set_factor_to_256_to_dis: The zoom to set. Set factor to 256 to disable zooming. A larger value enlarges the images (e.g. 512 double size), a smaller value shrinks it (e.g. 128 half size).
set_the_zoom_of_the_image: Set the zoom of the image
the_label_to_set_the_text: The label to set the text
set_the_text_of_the_label: Set the text of the label
the_roller_to_set_the_selected_item: The roller to set the selected item
use_animation_when_setting_the_selected_: Use animation when setting the selected item
set_the_selected_item_of_the_roller: Set the selected item of the roller
the_slider_to_set_the_value: The slider to set the value
set_the_value_of_the_slider: Set the value of the slider
set_a_new_value_for_the_left_knob_of_a_s: Set a new value for the left knob of a slider
set_minimum_and_the_maximum_values_of_a_: Set minimum and the maximum values of a slider
the_keyboard_to_set_the_textarea: The keyboard to set the textarea
set_the_textarea_for_the_keyboard: Set the textarea for the keyboard
the_group_to_focus_the_next_object: The group to focus the next object
focus_the_next_object_in_the_group: Focus the next object in the group
the_group_to_focus_the_previous_object: The group to focus the previous object
focus_the_previous_object_in_the_group: Focus the previous object in the group
the_group_to_get_the_focused_object: The group to get the focused object
the_variable_to_store_the_focused_object: The variable to store the focused object
get_the_focused_object_in_the_group: Get the focused object in the group
the_group_to_freeze_unfreeze_the_focus: The group to freeze/unfreeze the focus
true_freeze_false_release_freezing_norma: true: freeze, false: release freezing (normal mode)
do_not_let_to_change_the_focus_from_the_: Do not let to change the focus from the current object
the_group_to_set_the_wrap: The group to set the wrap
the_group_to_set_the_editing_mode: The group to set the editing mode
true_edit_mode_false_navigate_mode: true: edit mode, false: navigate mode
manually_set_the_current_mode_edit_or_na: Manually set the current mode (edit or navigate).
the_start_value_of_the_animation: The start value of the animation
the_end_value_of_the_animation: The end value of the animation
determines_whether_start_and_end_values_: Determines whether `Start` and `End` values are relative to the current value or are absolute values.
if_checked_apply_the_start_value_immedia: If checked apply the start value immediately, otherwise apply the start value after a delay when the animation really starts
animate_the_x_coordinate_of_the_object: Animate the x coordinate of the object
animate_the_y_coordinate_of_the_object: Animate the y coordinate of the object
animate_the_width_of_the_object: Animate the width of the object
animate_the_height_of_the_object: Animate the height of the object
animate_the_opacity_of_the_object: Animate the opacity of the object
animate_the_zoom_of_the_image: Animate the zoom of the image
animate_the_angle_of_the_image: Animate the angle of the image
